content.rendered:
Overview

ISO Certification/registration is a permit of approval from a 3rd party body that a company operates to one of the internationally appreciated ISO management systems. The certification can be utilized as a tender for business as evidence of a company’s credibility but also to establish trust in the potential client that you will keep your commitments.

Our Process

Step 1

Discussion & collecting required documents

Step 2

Selection of registration type

Step 3

Submission of the documents

Step 4

ISO certification Audit

Step 5

ISO certificate

Benefits

It heightens staff morale and motivation.

It creates Widened market potential

It Improves efficiency and cost savings

A higher level of customer service

The mark of an ISO 9001 Certification is automated branding and marketing of a product because it multiplies the trustworthiness of a business.

Having a recognized management standard tells customers that you are serious about their needs.

Government tenders and projects take tenders of companies that are ISO certified

ISO certifications lead to the goodwill of the business and increase repeat purchases.

Documents Required

Proof that the business is registered. This can be done through:

1. Certificate of Incorporation

2. GST Certificate

3. MSME Certificate

Copy of PAN Card

Passport size photograph

Copy of Aadhaar Card/ Voter identity card

Two copies of sales bill/purchase bill

A letterhead or visiting card of the business.

Quality manuals of the company

Clear All Your Doubts !

What is ISO certification?

ISO Certification is a seal of approval from a 3rd party body that a company runs to one of the internationally recognized ISO management systems. The certification can be used as a tender for business as proof of a company’s credibility but also to install confidence in the potential client that you will keep your promises.

What is an ISO 9001 certificate?
ISO 9001 certificate is a quality management system that can be integrated into any business. It is focused on ensuring the business delivers a consistent level of quality to its customers by having well-defined and regularly reviewed processes and procedures.

The system fully integrates within the existing business procedures and becomes part of the culture within the organization. Eventually, a business will not perform a task to confirm to the ISO 9001, it will perform the task for the good of the business.
How do I know that I am an ISO certified entity?

When you get ISO certified you will receive a certificate bearing a unique certificate number. Using such a unique number over the accreditation’s body website you can verify that your business is an ISO certified entity.

Does an ISO registration work as a permit or a license?

An ISO certification only certifies standards, it has got nothing to do with permits and licenses. Even though you might have an ISO certification, you still need government and authority permission, permits, and licenses to work your business.

Do I have to renew my ISO certificate?

Not really, but auditors do conduct surprise checks from time to time to see if your business standards and procedures meet the required ISO mark

What is the difference between all the accreditation bodies providing ISO certification?

There is no difference between accreditation bodies, and all of them are providing ISO Standards Certifications. The only difference you can mark is of market recognition, branding, and their prices.

Let’s start your business journey with Book My Consultant.

Interested
